content:
Has anyone considered or perhaps already held a pairing or mob programming session for Roc development?

I'm thinking that might be a really efficient and fun way to onboard some new people (thinking of myself here :sweat_smile:). I'd be highly interested in being a fly on the wall while someone is working on Roc -- either compiler work or core library stuff, Roc examples, etc.
We used to do a lot of pairing. Not really sure why that died off. I'm sure many compiler developers here are open to it.
Omg, is that possible? I didn't even think to ask that!
@Kiryl Dziamura I'm just a beginner, not sure where you're at in your Roc journey, but if you want to pair sometime let me know!
We could flounder around together as beginners :big_smile:

A great idea! Let's cooperate. I'm currently struggling with this https://github.com/roc-lang/roc/pull/5481/files, but almost done I think.
You can pick a ticket and we can look into it together, I can share what I've already learned on the way
